definition: background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: The moon is lightening, the breeze is blowing the valley.
sentences.chinese: 皓月當空，微風輕輕吹過谷底。

sentences.english: The moon shine brightly , the breeze blow across the bottom of gorge slightly.
sentences.chinese: 皓月當空，微風輕輕吹過谷底。

sentences.english: That point sticking out at the bottom can be adjusted up to 90 deg.
sentences.chinese: 堅持這一點在谷底可以調整到90度。

sentences.english: The European sovereign debt crisis is slowly driving the global economy back into the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲主權債務危機正在慢慢地將全球經濟推回谷底。

sentences.english: False bottoms and bear market rallies have trapped investors since time immemorial .
sentences.chinese: 投資者落入谷底假象和熊市止跌回升的陷阱久已有之。

sentences.english: The plunging water also sends out a never-ending roar as it strikes the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 飛流直下的河水撞擊谷底，也發出終年不息的轟鳴聲。

sentences.english: Listeners on Earth heard the countdown from Tranquility Base.
sentences.chinese: 地球上的聽衆聽到靜海谷底倒計時的聲音。

sentences.english: Mr Tung's popularity sank to an all-time low after the July protests.
sentences.chinese: 董建華的民望在七一遊行後跌至谷底。

sentences.english: A person standing at the bottom of a valley, no matter which direction he chooses, he could only go higher.
sentences.chinese: 站在谷底的人，無論朝哪個方向，都只會走得更高。

sentences.english: The river forms new meanders that curve along the valley floor.
sentences.chinese: 河流形成新的河曲，在谷底逶迤流淌。
我問他，“那麼哪兒纔是谷底呢？”

sentences.english: Notice how the image of the serpent is significant even in the sigil at the bottom of the page.
sentences.chinese: 公告的蛇是怎樣的形象，甚至在很大的圖章在谷底頁。

sentences.english: You boggle my mind and you make me go blind.
sentences.chinese: 你使我的大腦迷離墜入思維谷底。

sentences.english: Workers in the high-end of income scale, like housing, have yet to reach the depth of their recession.
sentences.chinese: 在高收入行業裏，像是房地產，已經衰退到了谷底。

sentences.english: We were at the bottom of a valley, and you know how the cold night air flows down valleys.
sentences.chinese: 我們在谷底，您知道如何寒夜的空氣流動下來的山谷。

sentences.english: A person standing at the botton of a valley, no matter which direction he chooses, he could only go higher.
sentences.chinese: 站在谷底的人，無論朝哪個方向走，都只會走得更高。

definition: valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
drop in elevation/(fig.) gap (in wages, expectations etc)/disparity
talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
to fall into/to dip below a certain level
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
